HIV Testing and Counseling Services are available at the NYU Student Health Center at no cost to all NYU students regardless of insurance. Individuals can gather educational materials, undergo confidential testing, and speak with a healthcare professional regarding any HIV-related issue in a safe, non-judgmental environment. Knowing your HIV status is the first step in getting information and taking action to stay healthy.     Knowing your HIV status is the first step in getting information and taking action to stay healthy.   Our dedicated HIV Counselor is available for HIV testing, providing educational materials, and/or answering questions regarding HIV-related issues. To schedule an appointment, call Primary Care at (212) 443-1122 or make an appointment online.   Testing for HIV and STIs (sexually transmitted infections) can also be performed during a routine visit with Primary Care and Women’s Health . A + A                                         Resources        open/close   General Resources     open/close   Student Affairs  Resources   Mentor & Career Advisor Program   Student Activities   International Health Program   Student Health   Master Scholars Program   Master's Programs   Staff & Contact Info   Student Accolades       open/close   Diversity Affairs  About Us   Recruitment   Education   Professional Development   Highlights and Announcements   LGBTQ Resources       open/close   Medical Education  About the Office of Medical Education   MD Curriculum   Clinical Training Sites       open/close   Student Health  About Us   Clinical Services  Blood Borne Pathogen Exposures   HIV/STD Services   Sackler Student Services   Travel Services     Mental Health Services   Emergencies   Immunization Info   New Student Info   Visiting Student Resources   Wellness Information   Additional Info   Confidentiality   Staff/Contact Info   Additonal Forms                                                                        HIV/STD Services                                         Sexual Transmitted Diseases   Sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) are among the most prevalent public health risks in the United States, with a large incidence occurring in young adults.  The Medical Student Health Service is available to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of infected students.  All screening and test results are confidential.   Gonorrhea and Chlamydia  Screening for Gonorrhea and Chlamydia is available for all medical students.  Women are screened for these STD's as part of a Women's Health exam.  During the pelvic exam, a small sample of cervical secretions is sent to the lab for evaluation.  Men are screened through a urine test.  While no appointment is needed for men requesting this testing, female students must make an appointment for the Women's Health Clinic.  To schedule an appointment, call 212-363-5489.   Herpes and Genital Warts  Screening for Herpes and Genital Warts is available for all medical students.  The healthcare provider at the Student Health Service will visually assess the external genital skin for signs of these infections.  At times, a culture is sent to the lab for confirmation of the herpes virus.  An appointment is not needed for this evaluation.  Treatment and counseling will be provided as needed.   HIV Testing  Testing for HIV is available to all medical students and Sackler graduate students.  HIV testing is done through a blood sample that is processed by the NYU Outpatient Laboratory.  Please allow two to three days for the results.  The rapid HIV test is not available at SHS at this time.  No appointment is needed for HIV testing.   For more information on STDs please come to the Student Health Service.   Fact sheets and counseling are available for:   HIV   Chlamydia   Gonorrhea   Hepatitis A, B, C   Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV)   Human Papillomavirus (HPV)   Molluscum   Syphilis   Trichomonas                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
